intro: Garnotia courtallensis var. divaricata, commonly known as the Divaricated Garnotia, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
